reviews.text: We booked and pre-paid this hotel for a weekend Fri-Sun. Upon arrival at 22 on Friday evening we were told that for our party of 6 they did not have the 3 double-rooms booked (admitting this was their fault and due to over-booking). Instead they arranged a taxi to take us to a more expensive hotel (Meriton Grand Hotel). We had especially chosen the St Olav hotel as it looked so charming and had a good location in old town. Because of this we told them that if we were not pleased with the new hotel we would come back. The new hotel (albeit of a higher standard) was a standard business hotel - looking like any Hilton or Radisson - and also located outside old town. Thus we went back to St Olav. After 45 minutes of waiting/arguing we were finally offered and shown three rooms: 1 economy room, 1 standard and 1 junior suite. We had booked 3 standard rooms but accepted their offer. When we were given the keys however we got 1 standard and 2 economy rooms! About 2 hours after we arrived at the hotel we were finally in our rooms. In the end we were very happy though that we had decided to fight for St Olav:
reviews.title: Nice but had to fight to get a room

reviews.text: The hotel is indeed very charming. The stairs are like a labyrinth and rooms individual (there are a lot of stairs and small corridors). Out small economy room was located in the attic and therefore very hot, but an open window solved this. Our bathroom was very small but not in the standard room. The standard room was big and had good temperature.
reviews.title: Nice place in the old town

reviews.text: Breakfast was good with some hot items although not refilled very often.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with tiny room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent with only 1-2 blocks to the middle of old town yet the street is quiet.
reviews.title: Not overly impressed

reviews.text: The girl at the reception was very nice and friendly, trying hard (it seemed) to get us rooms even though we were overbooked. The portiers were friendly as well. Only bad experience staff-wise was the receptionist on check-out. We handed in our keys and got a "You may leave now" only.
reviews.title: a total disappointment

likes.disliked: — the service at the reception, the breakfast, the room

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights over a birthday weekend. Ideal location, only a few minutes walk to the main square. Rooms were very good quality, bright, well furnished (no storage space for clothes however), if rooms were a little small. It must be a new hotel as everything was in good condition. Dont book this hotel if have mobility issues. No lift or concierge and lots of stairs to get to most of the rooms. We booked a double room and paid a bit extra for this, on arrival i lugged our cases up to the top floor only to find that we had a twin room. Went back down to reception, got another room, double this time, on the main road and was quite noisy at night.
reviews.title: Perfect location, quality hotel.
